Reviews.Title: Awesome system for the price!
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: So I bought this system based upon price, and a few other reviews. We've been having some vandalism in our area recently, and if something was going to happen to me, I was going to be ready and catch this hoodlum! I installed all 8 cameras and the DVR in just one Saturday. (wires ran down the wall and everything). The color quality isn't perfect, for example, the green's look a little purple; but still do-able. The DVR interface is easy to use, the manual on the other hand wasn't written very well, topics jump all over the book. I had to use YouTube to find out how to do a lot of stuff because the manual just didn't make a lot of sense. Anyway- DVR easy to use, everything, easy to install, video quality- pretty good, Night vision quality- pretty good. NOTE though: for areas like a small deck or patio, small front porch the cameras illuminate these area's very well, you can see fine; however, if you want to see in the dark with these cameras covering your yard, you will need a IR illuminator to light up the area so the cameras can see in the dark.Overall- I highly recommend the product for a small business, or home owner who wants to watch their property. You can't beat the features, quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: cameras are great...instructions stink
Reviews.Author: remo
Reviews.Content: the system is pretty awesome.  camera placement was real easy. the mounts are super lightweight and the cameras are easy to install. with a jacket that has a lot of pockets and a drill attachment that slides over the mounting screw heads to hold them in place, being high up on a ladder's a cinch.  the cables are really easy to plug together and if you're using a regular monitor, the dvr is super user friendly.....Now for the cons: you might as well throw out the instructions for internet viewing...they are basically in another language with the horrible English.  I have two words for the ZModo people...SPELL CHECK...Anyway, I went on youtube and found some standard DVR Remote Viewing instructional videos and with a little playing around it was successful.

Reviews.Title: Good product for its value
Reviews.Author: R.R "iLuvSeafood"
Reviews.Content: I Received zmodo 8 channel camera quickly from wennow. Amazon shipping took too long. I did a lot of research around and finally decided on this security camera system because it has 4+ star rating. The previous reviews were positive about this product. The setup is easy and it is ready to be used out of the box. For 8 camera system, 300 dollars are very good price, compare to the same system which will cost around 600 dollars.  I installed this system in my little shop. The camera quality is good, works ok during the day. The camera works best when the object of recording is within 5 to 10 feet range in a bright setting. It is not that clear for anything 20 feet away. Maybe the outline of the object is clear but you will not be able to tell the license plate number more than 20 feet. The night vision works better if a illuminating light source is used at the same time. For the price of this system, the image quality is acceptable. This system can be used as baby monitor. For its value, it can beat other baby monitor products valued at 200 dollars.  I will give is system 5 stars only if the network setup can be easier. The system didn't have detailed network setup instruction. The Manuel contain little information on how to use this system. It is very difficult to setup the network if you just looking at the Manuel and doing tons of research online. For beginners if you like to view your camera from you computer over the same network, you need to install the software from the small disc and do the ip configuration too. There is a more detailed instruction from YouTube which tells you how to setup the network locally. I gave up the wireless network setup because it is beyond the ability of a college graduate. There is no instruction on that anywhere in the package.  Anyway, it is a good system for its value and the network setup instruction sucks!

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: This product was promptly delivered.  However, there was a problem.  The instructions to unlock the box were not included.  I returned the first one thinking it was a faulty box.  When the second one did not function either, I called Zmodo and was given instructions on how to unlock.  It was easy to set up, the video quality is good, and I'm really impressed with the software that allows me to watch and review over the internet or even my Iphone.  Overall, I would recommend this product but make sure you have the instructions to unlock the DVR.

Reviews.Title: Decent product
Reviews.Author: L. Ford
Reviews.Content: Received this DVR and cameras last week.  The DVR seems to be ok, but time will tell.  Camera's are a little cheap but surprisingly give decent color after adjusting hue and saturation.Connecting to my network was easy but I'm having problems with the web display.  Internet explorer will not connect consistently, and the downloaded software will not connect at all.I spent over an hour on  chat with tech support in China.  The guy was very patient and helpful and even spoke better English than some of my friends.If you are looking for great quality video, this is not the system for you.  If you want decent video and the peace of mind security, then this will do the trick.Update - After playing with the video format in teh DVR software I was able to get the LIVE feed of the video working.  I just keep getting more and more impressed with this product the more I play with it.

Reviews.Title: Bad All Around
Reviews.Author: Mark M. "X111"
Reviews.Content: The cameras are slightly blurry and there is no way to focus them.The night vision claims to work out to 30 feet. However, this is not true outside.I tested the night vision inside, and it seemed to work pretty well.However, after mounting the cameras high on the sides of the house, the cameras see nothing but black at night. The images are 100% black and no shapes are visible.Note: We live in the country, and there are no "city" lights to help with night vision.The plastic thumb screws break off easily, and then you have to use needle nose pliers to tighten the screws in place to mount the camera arm.The DVR only allows one camera to be in D1 recording mode.It only allows one camera in HD2 mode, too.Bottom line... This system is generally bad all around and I will likely be returning it soon.UPDATE 08/12/2012:After returning this system, I purchased a Swann security system. The Swann is a much better system and I highly recommend it over the Zmodo. The Swann system is better in every detail from cameras, to the DVR.

Reviews.Title: Missing Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: Sam Hill "Sam"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product for my brother's store as a gift.  He and another worker had it set up and running within 4 hours.  He had a theft a few months after the installation.  The police officer that came in to review the video said there was no hard drive in the unit.  We ended up taking the DVR apart and never found a hard drive.  There was no external hard drive in the packaging either.  Well, needless to say I call Zmodo because I had waited too long to get service through amazon.  The folks with Zmodo support kindly told me that it was not their problem - even thought the SKU I ordered through amazon was the one that said it included the 500GB Hard Drive.  I provided receipts and everything they asked for but never got the issue resolved with Zmodo customer service.  They suggested I return the entire package to amazon.  First of all it was a gift and my brother and a co-worker spent half a day wiring and installing the new system.  I finally had him go out and buy an external hard drive to connect to the system and it is now recording successfully.  Maybe amazon is a little responsible and maybe I am for not following up sooner. Zmodo should provide better customer support.  The quality of the video is pretty good and the system seems fairly easy to navigate.  I was able to set up web and remote viewing without incident but I am not a fan of the customer support at Zmodo as I was cheated out of a hard drive that should have came with the system.

User guide is not clear enough and I have to do research for that set up. At the end everything done. System working OK for about 8 months and suddenly stop working. Power light still on but system can't start up. I try to turn it off and on many times, sometimes it works , sometimes not. I feel this DVR is not reliable for security system and one more thing is in playback mode, you can not view all 8 camera at the same time. I have to order another DVR with other brand name for my security system. Very disappointed for this product.

Its Linux based core system, so its very stable as well.Camera quality is pretty good and so is the view on cell phones. Cameras work pretty good in LOW light conditions as well. Overall, very satisfied with the product.Only draw back, TECH support SUCKS. So god forbid you goof up something, then you will need to do some serious research online to get it going.Best part is the ZMODO site is 200% better than their Tech Support.

If you do not have a computer background don't even bother.The interface of the DVR software is simple enough - allows you to pull up recorded videoit only allows you to playback 4 screens at a time instead of the full 8 so if you want to view all 8 screens to need to do it twice.Once I finally got it dialed in smoothly the hardware started to go out.first the cables ( 2 of the 8 got damaged / worn over time )then over a year later the HDD fried - their website claims they use DVR friendly HDDs to prevent this very thing yet mine broke anyways.Since it has been over a year the manufacture wont warranty the HDD so I'm on my own to try to fix it -I won't spend more money on this junk - moving on to something better

Reviews.Title: WORST SECURITY SYSTEM ON THE MARKET--IT IS JUNK
Reviews.Author: Laron Taylor "laronvonbaron"
Reviews.Content: well spent 400.00 running 8 100 foot wires --mounting cameras 3 hrs only to find the remote will not turn the recorder  on or off and there is not on -off switch on the box its self--so now what spend another 400 paying employees to undo all of the work so i can send this junk back--save your self time and money --not to mention the frustration--and just pass on anything that says ZMODO on the box--i recommend QSEE and i am sorry i did not spend the extra 40.00-----VERY SORRY---getting tired of returning this crap from china --amazon is letting quality take a back seat to service----what service is it when you have to return every third item you buy---going to new egg for any purchase over 50.00 us----AND JUST TO TOP IT OFF THIS IS THE 15 STEP PROCEDURE FOR DOWNLOADING THE FILES FROM YOU 500 GIG hd--------Remove hard drive from the unit, this model has a slide out cartridge containing the hard drive. With other models you may have to take the unit apart.2Break the Warranty stickers and slide cover off the drive housing (note this will void the warranty on the drive).3Unscrew drive from housing and remove drive.4Obtain a USB to SATA converter cable from an electronics store or online.5Q-See systems are based on Linux so in order to read the drive from the DVR you'll need to install drivers for windows for the ext2/3 file system that the drive is formatted with. Sourceforge has an open source free driver. Ext2 IFS For Windows at [...]6Plug Drive into your windows machine7Install PlaybackSetup_2.3.0.4.exe which should be on the setup CD that came with your DVR. In this folder: "C:\Program Files\Playback\" you should find the "NVR Export Tool" along with other helpful files you may need.8Open the "NVR Export Tool" from "C:\Program Files\Playback\NvrExport.exe" this program came from the setup CD that came with your DVR.9The drive should show up as a drive on your computer. In my case Drive N: there will also be a drive J: however drive N: is the drive with the goods.10Open the NvrExport tool and select "Directory" the directory you select should be labeled as the date you want to backup. In my case N:\2010-01-2111Create a folder on the drive you want to "backup" to. I chose J:\Q-See Backups\2010-01-21 you have to create the subfolder so you don't accidentally put the files in the wrong place.12Place the folder you created in the "destination" field of the NvrExport tool.13Click the "Export" button. Depending on how many recordings there are you may have to wait hours for it to complete.14While it is "Exporting" you will start to files appear with names such as ch00000000000001-100121-000000-000000-12p001000000.264 in the destination folder you created on your hard drive.15After your export is complete you can load up the "Playback Software" (this software also came on the setup CD that came with your DVR) choose the folder where you exported the files to and you should be able to view and export them again but as *.avi files to send to law enforcement or for other purposes.SEE WHAT I MEAN  this is insane are they for real --the older 4 channel model allowed downloads with a few clicks I sold my 4 channel and bought this ---WOW WAS I SORRY

I love the fact that you can zoom in by just drawing a box around the image and isolate it from everything else. One draw back I found was that you must install them under an eve or make a small shelter for it.  I installed one directly in the open and second guess myself on providing shelter for it relying on the weatherproof wording on the box and it got cloudy after the first shower of rain.  I had to unscrew the front and dried it out then rotate it with one that was inside and made a shelter for the replacement.  I'm about to purchase a second set for our retail store.
